overview: This subject covers the principles of general dental practice including treatment planning and the practice of integrated dental care encompassing complex periodontal treatment, endodontics, fixed and removable prosthodontics, paediatric dentistry, orthodontics and management of patients having extensive and/or complex treatment needs due to medical conditions, a severely compromised dental status and/or high caries risk.

This subject introduces students to more complex aspects of restorative dental treatment including the basic concepts and application of implant dentistry as part of a comprehensive treatment plan and overdentures.

additional pre-requisite: Successful completion of all second year DDS subjects.

assessments.description: 1 x combined Paediatric Dentistry and Orthodontics Objective Structured Clinical Examination (OSCE). 1 hours
1 x OSCE on Advanced Endodontics, Fixed Prosthodontics and Implants. 1 hours
1 x OSCE exam on Prosthodontics and Endodontics. 1 hours
1 x written exam on Orthodontics and paediatric dentistry, Advanced Endodontics, Fixed Prosthodontics and Implants. 2.5 hours
1 x written exam on clinical general dental practice, high caries risk, treatment planning and complex periodontics. 2.5 hours
Hurdle requirement:. 75% attendance at Lectures; 100% attendance at Practical Classes, Clinical Sessions, and Clinical & Case Simulations/Discussions

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
